meanings.definition: To grant or convey (property) by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: He feoffs his land to his son.
meanings.sent2: She feoffs the house to her sister.
meanings.sent3: The farmer feoffs his cows to the sheep.
meanings.sent4: The teacher feoffs knowledge to her students.
meanings.sent5: The king feoffs his kingdom to the prince.

meanings.definition: A grant or conveyance of property by feoffment.
meanings.sent1: The feoffs of the estate were recorded in the documents.
meanings.sent2: She received a feoffs of the land from her grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The feoffs of the castle were celebrated with a feast.
meanings.sent4: The feoffs of the company were carefully managed.
meanings.sent5: The feoffs of the property were disputed among the heirs.
